head.title: Of Subtlety And Salt: A Taste Test

hedline.hl1: Of Subtlety And Salt: A Taste Test

abstract.p: W Park Kerr's Tequila Nacional Silver brand is made with 100 percent blue agave juice; despite its popular image as a party drink, connoisseurs regard premium tequila as equal to single-malt Scotch in subtlety of bouquet and flavor; drawing (M)

block.p: THE popular image of tequila has always been of a party drink, of ritualistic salt-licking and lime-sucking, of frozen margaritas and barroom games. But to connoisseurs, tequila has a whole other single-malt-Scotch side, with some versions costing hundreds of dollars a bottle and made for sipping out of brandy glasses while noting subtleties of bouquet and flavor.

In his new Tequila Nacional Silver, W. Park Kerr has made a tequila that connoisseurs will appreciate. With its pure aromas of minerals, salt and lime, and smooth yet biting agave flavor, I found that Nacional already tastes like the essence of a good margarita.

THE popular image of tequila has always been of a party drink, of ritualistic salt-licking and lime-sucking, of frozen margaritas and barroom games. But to connoisseurs, tequila has a whole other single-malt-Scotch side, with some versions costing hundreds of dollars a bottle and made for sipping out of brandy glasses while noting subtleties of bouquet and flavor.

In his new Tequila Nacional Silver, W. Park Kerr has made a tequila that connoisseurs will appreciate. With its pure aromas of minerals, salt and lime, and smooth yet biting agave flavor, I found that Nacional already tastes like the essence of a good margarita.

Tequilas come in two basic forms. Ordinary blended tequilas, including familiar brands like Jose Cuervo, start with anywhere from 51 to 99 percent agave juice. Top-flight tequilas are made with 100 percent blue agave and always say so on the label; Nacional is an example.

Tequilas are also categorized by age. A white or silver tequila has little or no aging. Reposados are aged in wood at least 60 days, and often up to a year, while anejos must be aged at least a year in small wooden barrels. Aging in wood typically mellows tequila, giving it a golden-brown color and often adding complexity. Some blended tequilas are brown or gold, but the color comes from the addition of caramel or other coloring agents, not from aging.

Some people say silver tequilas are the purest expression of agave, with flavors unchanged by wood. I don't think I would sip Nacional Silver after dinner the way I might Cognac or an extra-smooth anejo tequila. But it will make an excellent margarita, straight up, no salt needed.
